mechanics: Grid-based maze navigation with arrow keys/touch controls
Player must collect 'forms' (A-27, B-14, C-9) scattered in maze
NPCs block paths asking for specific forms
Collecting wrong form sends player back to start
Maze procedurally regenerates on wrong form collection
No actual exit - game loops infinitely with increasing frustration messages
Score tracks: forms collected, NPCs encountered, restarts
Easter egg: Collecting all 3 forms reveals 'exit' that leads to new maze
notes: D-pad controls positioned directly below canvas
Touch controls: 4 directional arrows in grid layout
Desktop: Arrow keys, mobile: touch buttons
Player: cyan square, NPCs: red squares, forms: yellow dots, walls: white
NPC dialogue appears in text div below controls
Procedural maze generation using recursive backtracker algorithm
Forms spawn in dead ends for maximum frustration
NPCs patrol corridors with simple AI
Status bar shows: Forms: A[ ] B[ ] C[ ] | Restarts: X
Noir theme: dark background, cyan player, red obstacles
Existential messages: 'Please take a number', 'Form expired', 'Wrong window'
After 10 restarts: 'You've been here before' message appears
Mobile-first: All touch targets 50px+, responsive text sizing

userPrompt:
maze game

extremely elaborate DMV maze game with no way out

warnings.message: Body has padding: 20px which may conflict with required padding-top: 80px. Consider using padding: 80px 20px 20px 20px;
Canvas has fixed width/height (600x600) which may not scale optimally on all devices. Consider using CSS-only sizing or dynamic canvas sizing.

docs.releaseNotes: yeah so i built this dmv bureaucracy maze thing - collect forms A-27, B-14, C-9 while dodging NPCs who ask for paperwork you don't have yet. got mobile d-pad controls that work smooth on phones, procedural maze generation, and an easter egg exit that just loops you into more despair. very kafkaesque, very arcade.
docs.howToPlay: **Controls:** Arrow keys or mobile d-pad to navigate. **Objective:** Collect forms scattered in the maze (A-27, B-14, C-9). **Warning:** NPCs block paths and demand specific forms - give them the wrong one and you restart. Score tracks your forms, encounters, and restarts. There may or may not be an exit. Probably not.
